result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle E Berschneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined. 
Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. Order for DNA to be mailed to the defendant. Must report to the Barron County Jail within 30 days of release from custody to submit DNA sample.
Must have no contact with K.F.S.

11:42 AM Defendant Kyle E Berschneider appeared by video, in custody from Washburn County Jail.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Kyle E Berschneider. Victim rights have been complied with. Plea questionnaire filed. 

Defendant will pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Court relates and orders: 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence 

6 months jail - STAYED 

1 year probation - IMPOSED - Concurrent to any other sentence currently being served. 
Must have no contact with K.F.S. 
Court costs to include all applicable fees/surcharges to be paid within 60 days. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Order for DNA  to be mailed to the defendant. Must report to the Barron County Jail within 30 days of release from custody to submit DNA sample.
